meanings.definition: Bend or give way under pressure
meanings.sent1: The old chair was buckling under my weight.
meanings.sent2: The bridge started buckling during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The bookshelf was buckling with all the heavy books on it.
meanings.sent4: His knees were buckling from exhaustion after the long hike.
meanings.sent5: The tree was buckling in the strong wind, swaying dangerously.

meanings.sent1: She was buckling her belt before going out.
meanings.sent2: He quickly buckled his bag before running to catch the bus.
meanings.sent3: The child was buckling the toy car to the remote control.
meanings.sent4: The hiker was buckling the straps of his backpack tightly.
meanings.sent5: The diver was buckling the oxygen tank securely before diving.

meanings.sent1: The fireworks were buckling in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The thunderstorm was buckling loudly outside.
meanings.sent3: The balloon was buckling unexpectedly, startling everyone.
meanings.sent4: The car engine was buckling, causing concern for the driver.
meanings.sent5: The old building was buckling with each gust of wind, creaking ominously.
